Package org.world

Class World

java.lang.Object
org.world.World
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class World
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
The World class groups information about the various game objects currently present and active. It can be thought of as an individual level in the game This class handles the updating and rendering of all the game objects present in the game Currently implements a wave based/survival-type 16x16 tiles level in which the player's goal is to survive for as long as possible
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • World

      public World()

  • Method Details

    • CameraShake

      public void CameraShake​(int duration, int intensit)
      Applies camera shake to screen
      Parameters:
      duration - in 1/60ths of a second
      intensit - values of 1 or 2 should be enough

    • initialiseWorld

      public void initialiseWorld()
      Initialize all the game world objects and other needed variables for a functioning world. Currently creates a 16 x 16 map

    • update

      public void update()
      Handles every update related action during a normal game loop. It iterates through the list of game objects, updating them , removes ones that are no longer needed and inserts new game objects as needed.

    • render

      public void render()
      Renders all the game objects and the terrain contained in the world object. Before the actual rendering objects are sorted based on their distance to the screen, so that the furthest objects are render first (behind objects in the foreground).

    • addGameObject

      public void addGameObject​(GameObject go)
      Adds a game object to a buffer to be added next update cycle. Checks the object's coordinates to make sure it has a valid position (isometric coordinates). If the object does not pass the check it is discarded. Also increases the world's enemy count when the added object was an enemy.
      Parameters:
      go - game object to be added

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer​(Player p)
      Adds a Player object to the game and creates a reference to it for easy access. Also creates the hud object and binds it to the player. Can only add one player to the game since the engine doesn't support multiplayer. If a player is already present then the method simply returns without doing anything.
      Parameters:
      p - newly created player object

    • getTerrain

      public Terrain getTerrain()
      Returns the terrain, used for pathfinding and movement

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Returns the player object

    • getDecorations

      public GameObject[][] getDecorations()
      Returns the decoration array. "Decorations" are passive game objects that can serve as obstacles in movement

    • getHUD

      public HUD getHUD()
      Returns the HUD(heads-up display = in-game menu/user interface)

    • togglePause

      public void togglePause()
      Pauses or un-pauses the game

    • isPaused

      public boolean isPaused()
      Checks whether the game is paused

    • getWave

      public int getWave()
      Gets the value of the current wave of enemies
      Returns:
      wave # as an int

    • getTime

      public int getTime()
      Returns the current time elepsed since the last wave
      Returns:
      time as an integer

    • inBounds

      public boolean inBounds​(int isoX, int isoY)
      Checks whether the given isometric coordinate are valid given the current size of the game world
      Parameters:
      isoX - isometric coordinate
      isoY - isometric coordinate
